Sentencas: Hydrocarbon fuels such as CH4 can be converted into H-2 and CO by direct internal reforming (DIR) processes within the anode of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Numerical simulation and thermal stress analysis of direct internal reforming SOFCs

Sentencas: DIR-SOFCs can reduce system complexity and capital cost due to the elimination of external reformers.
Titulo: Numerical simulation and thermal stress analysis of direct internal reforming SOFCs

Sentencas: However, the strong endothermic reforming reactions at the cell entrance may result in large thermal stress, leading to premature failure.
Titulo: Numerical simulation and thermal stress analysis of direct internal reforming SOFCs

Sentencas: In this study, a numerical simulation study was carried out to analyze the effect of operating conditions and cell structures on temperature, composition and thermal stress distributions in DIR-SOFCs.
Titulo: Numerical simulation and thermal stress analysis of direct internal reforming SOFCs

Sentencas: A two-dimensional axisymmetric model was developed by considering the coupling effects of the chemical/electrochemical reactions; transport processes of mass, charge, or heat; and thermal mechanical stress.
Titulo: Numerical simulation and thermal stress analysis of direct internal reforming SOFCs

Sentencas: The failure probability of the cell was estimated by stress distributions.
Titulo: Numerical simulation and thermal stress analysis of direct internal reforming SOFCs

Sentencas: Simulation results show that the increase of the steam-to-carbon ratio and operating voltage leads to higher thermal stresses and higher failure probability.
Titulo: Numerical simulation and thermal stress analysis of direct internal reforming SOFCs

Sentencas: The introduction of a metal supportive layer may release the thermal stress problem at severe DIR-SOFC operation conditions, which leads to a flatter temperature distribution and smaller failure probability compared to anode-supported SOFCs.
Titulo: Numerical simulation and thermal stress analysis of direct internal reforming SOFCs
